com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator
Class DeployValidatorService

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.DeployValidatorService
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDomainValidatorService
public class DeployValidatorService
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDomainValidatorService

Capability access point for SOA deploy topology validation extensions.

Provides a registry for obtaining DomainValidator extensions, and convenience methods for invoking validation on all validators.

See Also:
DeployValidatorJob

Method Detail

getDefaultValidatorService

public static DeployValidatorService getDefaultValidatorService()
Returns the default instance of the deploy validator service.

The default service is cached using theDEFAULT_SERVICE_ID key.

Returns:
the default validator service.

getValidatorService

public static DeployValidatorService getValidatorService(java.lang.Object key)
Returns the validator service associated with the key.

The result may be null if the key was never associated with a service or the service has been garbage collected

Parameters:
key - any object with a well defined Object.hashCode() method (e.g. String).
Returns:
the cached DeployValidatorService instance (may be null);

getOrCreateValidatorService

public static DeployValidatorService getOrCreateValidatorService(java.lang.Object key)
Return the cached DeployValidatorService based on the key or creates a new service.

Note the newly created service will NOT be cached. You should invoke cacheValidatorService(Object, DeployValidatorService).

Parameters:
key - the key used to lookup an existing service (may be null).
Returns:
an existing or newly created DeployValidatorService (never null).

cacheValidatorService

public static void cacheValidatorService(java.lang.Object key,
                                         DeployValidatorService service)
This is a way for clients to cache their DeployValidatorService for others to reuse.

It is up to the client to define the key and publicize it for its clients.

The passed service will be cached as a WeakReference.

Parameters:
key - any non-null object with a well defined Object.hashCode() method (e.g. String).
service - An instance of DeployValidatorService.
See Also:
getValidatorService(Object), removeCachedValidatorService(Object)

removeCachedValidatorService

public static void removeCachedValidatorService(java.lang.Object key)
Used to removed a cached DeployValidatorService instance.

Parameters:
key - any object with a well defined Object.hashCode() method (e.g. String).
See Also:
cacheValidatorService(Object, DeployValidatorService)

isDomainValidatorEnabled

public boolean isDomainValidatorEnabled(java.lang.String domainID)
Check if the validator declared for a domain is enabled.

Disabled domain validators are not invoked by validate(IDeployValidationContext, IDeployReporter).

Parameters:
domainID - a domain extension point ID
Returns:
true if validation for the domain is enabled, false otherwise.
See Also:
IDomainValidator.getDomainID()

setDomainValidatorEnabled

public void setDomainValidatorEnabled(java.lang.String domainID,
                                      boolean enabled)
Enables or disables the validator of a domain.

Parameters:
domainID - the ID of the domain extension.
enabled - true to enable the validator of the domain, false otherwise.

getUnitValidators

public java.util.List<IUnitValidator> getUnitValidators(EClass type)
Returns the IUnitValidator associated with the unit type.

Queries all domain validators of type UnitDomainValidator.

Parameters:
type - a subtype of Unit.
Returns:
an unmodifiable list of unit validators (never null).

getDomainValidators

public java.util.Collection<IDomainValidator> getDomainValidators(Topology topology)
Returns the domain validators that are applicable to the types contained in the topology.

Parameters:
topology - an SOA topology containing units, services and links from different domains.
Returns:
an unmodifiable list of validators applicable to the topology (never null).

an unmodifiable list of domain validators (never null).

getResolutions

public java.util.List<IDeployResolution> getResolutions(IStatus status)
Returns the resolutions that can be applied to the specified status.

The resolutions are sorted in reverse priority order (higher to lower).

Parameters:
status - a status that may contain IDeployStatus.
Returns:
an unmodifiable list of bound deploy resolutions (never null).

hasResolutions

public boolean hasResolutions(IStatus status)
Checks if the status has deploy resolutions associated with it.

Parameters:
status - a status that may contain or be a deploy status.
Returns:
true if the status contains deploy status, and there are resolutions for that status.

hasResolutionGenerators

public boolean hasResolutionGenerators(IStatus status)
Checks if the status has deploy resolution generators associated with it.

Parameters:
status - a status that may contain or be a deploy status.
Returns:
true if the status contains deploy status, and there are resolution generators for that status.

validate

public IStatus validate(IDeployValidationContext context,
                        IDeployReporter reporter)
Description copied from interface: IDomainValidatorService
Validates the topology using all the applicable domain validators.

Topology validation issues are reported using IDeployReporter.addStatus(com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.status.IDeployStatus).

Specified by:
validate in interface IDomainValidatorService
Parameters:
context - the domain validation context (used to extract the topology).
reporter - used to create deploy markers.
Returns:
the status of the validation process itself, not related to the status of the topology itself.

validate

public IStatus validate(IDeployValidationContext context,
                        IDeployReporter reporter,
                        java.util.Collection<IDomainValidator> validators)
Validate the context topology using the specified list of domain validators.

Parameters:
context - the validation context identifying the topology.
reporter - the mechanism for reporting validation issues.
validators - the collection of validators to be used.
Returns:
the status of the validation process itself, not related to the status of the topology itself.

validate

public void validate(Topology topology)
Validates an in-memory topology in the invoking thread.

To perform asynchronous validation as a Job invoke #scheduleValidation(Topology)

Parameters:
topology - the topology to be validated.
